summary: Code coverage reports show all workflow lines as uncovered in TestWorkflowEnvironment even though tests do execute signals and queries. This is due to workflow code executing in a sandbox environment which makes coverage tracking difficult.
userImpact: Developers cannot accurately measure code coverage for workflow unit tests, making it difficult to assess test completeness.
rootCause: Workflow code executes in a sandbox environment which prevents standard code coverage instrumentation from working correctly.
resolutionDetails: Resolved by creating the @temporalio/nyc-test-coverage package to handle code coverage specifically for sandboxed workflow code.
keyQuote: This is probably going to be tricky with the way workflow code executes in the sandbox
